title: That’s What He Said
dek: An Exploration of Michael Scott’s misquotes, mispronunciations, and botched phrases

misquotes.writer: Ricky Gervais, Stephen Merchant, Greg Daniels

lines.speaker: michael
lines.line: It’s really beyond words… It’s really incalcalable

misquotes.writer: Ricky Gervais, Stephen Merchant, and Greg Daniels

lines.speaker: Dwight
lines.line: Ugh, damnit, Jim!

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Hold on, hold on, judge is in session, what is the problem here?

misquotes.explanation: The phrase is “court is in session” not “judge is in session”

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Abraham Lincoln once said that “If you are a racist, I will attack you with the North”

misquotes.explanation: Abraham Lincoln did not say that

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: I should've gotten… some burritos or colored greens.

lines.speaker: Stanley
lines.line: It’s collard greens.

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: What?

lines.speaker: Stanley
lines.line: It’s collard greens

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Well that doesn’t really make sense, because you don’t call them collared people, that’s offensive.

misquotes.correction: Stanley is correct, it’s collard greens, not colored greens.

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Generosity and togetherness and community all convalescences into morale.

misquotes.correction: It’s convalesces

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Blessed be those who sit and wait

misquotes.correction: This is not a saying. Perhaps Michael is confusing Luke 12:37, "Blessed are those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall find watching: verily I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and make them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serve them"

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: [To Darryl] You better bring you A-game, because me and my posse guys are gonna be in your face

misquotes.correction: It's just posse, not “posse guys”

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Foul! Naked aggression [referring to Roy fouling Jim in basketball]

misquotes.correction: Naked aggression is not a type of basketball foul, this case was probably a flagrant foul

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: [To pam] Busy work, ah get away cretin

misquotes.correction: Cretin means a stupid person, maybe he was referring to Pam bringing in the busy work, but this seems like an incorrect usage of cretin

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Hello Ryan, this is Michael Jackson, calling from Wonderland

misquotes.correction: He means Neverland, Michael Jackson's ranch

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: This is sort of a Ying Yang thing

misquotes.correction: It’s “Yin and Yang” but Michael pronounces it as if Yin ends with a ‘g’

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: [referring to his signature] The Michael is all cursive, Scott is all caps. Sort of a left brain right brain thing

misquotes.correction: Left brain is analytical right is creative so his cursive/all caps is backwards, should be right brain/left brain

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: The deal was for one punch, which I absorbed, I had no idea there'd be a second punch. So, catch-22

misquotes.correction: That’s not what “catch-22” means

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: "Are you talkin' to me? You talkin' to me?" Raging Bull, Pacino

misquotes.correction: Actually that quote is from Robert DeNiro in Taxi Driver

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Just leave me as his contact and I will call the hospital. Cut out the middleman [referring to Dwight putting “the hospital” as his emergency contact]

misquotes.correction: Actually that's adding a middleman

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: And if everyone would just chip in a little bit, it would help me out. What do you say? Let's gang bang this thing and go home

misquotes.correction: Gang bang refers to rape or gang violence, Michael means "Let's bang this thing out"

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: We’re going to have our weekly suggestion box meeting, so you can all get in your constructive compliments ASAP

misquotes.correction: He means constructive criticism, not constructive compliments

lines.speaker: Toby
lines.line: Aren’t the suggestions meant for you?

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Well Toby, if by me, you were inferring that I have BO, then I would say that that is a very poor choice of words

misquotes.correction: Toby was implying, not inferring

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: I do think that I am very approachable, as one of the guys. But maybe I need to be even approachabler

misquotes.correction: He means “more approachable”. Approachabler isn't a word

lines.speaker: Kevin
lines.line: [referring to the top of the christmas tree they just chopped off] But what are we gonna do with this hacked off part?

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Well, that is a perfectly good mini-tree Kevin. And we are going to sell that to charity

misquotes.correction: You donate things to charity, not sell

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: In an office, when you are ranking people, manager is higher than captain. On a boat, who knows? It's nebulose

misquotes.correction: He mispronounces nebulous, he says it like “neb-yoo-lows”

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: I tried hopping, Kevin, and I bumped my elbow against the wall and now my elbow has a protruberance

misquotes.correction: It’s protuberance, with an “r”

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: [Singing] /My lips are sealed/. Bangals

misquotes.correction: The lyric is "Our lips are sealed' and it's by the Go-Go's, not the Bangals

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: “I am Pam”...Spicoli Guy

misquotes.correction: Sean Penn who played the character Spicoli in Fast Times At Ridgemont High. Penn also starred in I Am Sam, apparently Michael is mashing up these two roles into one reference

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: It is Valentine’s Day. It’s New York, city of love

misquotes.correction: Paris is the city of love, not New York

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Here it is, heart of New York City: Times Square. Named for the good times you have when you're in it

misquotes.correction: Times Square is named for the headquarters of the New York Times, not what Michael said

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: This is the world-famous Rockerfeller Center. Founded of course by Theodore Rockerfeller

misquotes.correction: Rockerfeller Center was actually founded by John D. Rockerfeller Jr.

misquotes.ep_title: Take Your Daughter to Work Day

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: I am like Superman, and the people who work here are like citizens of Gotham City

misquotes.correction: Batman guards Gotham city, not Superman

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: The party planning committee is all over it, they have been working 24/7 all day yesterday

misquotes.correction: It should be 24/7 or all day yesterday, not both

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: [pointing to a poster of James Dean] I bet Luke Perry's friends don't treat him like this

misquotes.correction: The person in the poster is James Dean, not Luke Perry

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: [gesturing to Pam’s breasts] Those things are ticking time bags

misquotes.correction: He means ticking time bombs

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Dude where's my office? I totally lost it, cause I was half-baked, smokin' doobies, doobie brothers, smoking doobies with my brothers

misquotes.correction: half-baked is a stoner comedy from 1998, also the term for half-formed idea, also a Ben and Jerry's flavor... I feel like typically if you were stoned you would just say 'baked' not 'half-baked'. Also the rest of this sequence is clearly Michael not understanding drugs or being high

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Peace out Seacrest!

misquotes.correction: Mash-up of "Seacrest out!" which was Ryan Seacrest's sign-off catchphrase in his early days, and "Peace out"

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Mmm munchies, who wants some munchies?

misquotes.correction: Munchies could be hunger pangs or light snacks, but Michael is using it in the context of being high, which would indicate hunger pangs, but he uses it in the way to mean snacks

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: [Michael has written "Heroine" on his list of illegal drugs]

misquotes.correction: It's misspelled, the drug is "Heroin", "Heroine" is a female hero

lines.speaker: Toby
lines.line: Hookah is not an illegal drug, Michael

misquotes.correction: Toby is correct, Michael insists Hookah is an illegal drug, but it is not

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: It's for charity. And I consider myself a great philanderer

misquotes.correction: He means Philanthropist

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: [to Jan] You are the Eva Peron to my Cesar Chavez

misquotes.correction: Cesar Chavez was an american labor activist, he might mean Juan Peron, Eva Peron’s husband, or Hugo Chavez, the former dictator of Venezuela

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: [referring to him and Jan] But we've remained good friends. Good friends with privileges

misquotes.correction: He means Friends with benefits

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: I am going to donate to Afghanistani's with AIDS

misquotes.correction: It’s Afghani, not Afghanistani. Also that's not a real charity, maybe he means the "Afghanaid" charity?

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Two queens on Casino Night. I am going to drop a deuce on everybody

misquotes.correction: Perhaps he means “drop a bomb on them”

lines.speaker: Michael
lines.line: Let's get it started. Black Eyed Crows

misquotes.correction: That song is by the Black Eyed Peas, not crows
